intro: Astragalus bonariensis, commonly known as the Chilean milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky environments. The plant produces small, yellow or greenish flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of oval-shaped leaflets. Astragalus bonariensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
